The mechanism of adhesion of the pectin nanocapsules on the cotton bag surface in the presence of acrylate may be attributed to surface modification of cotton fibers, illustrated in a supplementary figure (Supplementary Fig S4). During curing the process at 100 °C, there might be an interaction between –OH group of cellulose (Cell-OH) and –COOH group of acrylate, which may lead to formation of ester linkage. The statement is according to previous reports
26, 52 . The ester linkage might be responsible for deposition of pectin -CWO nanocapsules on cotton-bag fibers.
